name: GlobalError (404)
description: The GlobalError is a simple component to integrate where a 404 or 500 message has to be shown.

props.name: statusCode
props.doc: Defines a status code as a string. When `404` or `500` is given, predefined `text` and `title` will be shown. Defaults to `404`.

props.name: status
props.doc: Defines a status code as a string. When `404` or `500` is given, predefined `text` and `title` will be shown. Defaults to `404`. This prop is deprecated and will be removed in v11, please use `statusCode` instead.

props.name: title
props.doc: Overwrites the default title for the provided `statusCode`.

props.name: text
props.doc: Overwrites the default text for the provided `statusCode`.

props.name: code
props.doc: Overwrites the default error message code text `Feilmeldings-kode:`. . This prop is deprecated and will be removed in v11, please use `errorMessageCode` instead.

props.name: errorMessageCode
props.doc: Overwrites the default error message code text `Feilmeldings-kode: %statusCode`.

props.name: help
props.doc: Overwrites the default additional help text `Her er noen lenker som kanskje kan hjelpe:`. This text is only rendered when `links` are provided.

props.name: links
props.doc: Provide an array with objects `{ text: "Text", url: "https://..." }` to display a list of anchor links.

props.name: center
props.doc: If true, it will use `80vh` as the height and center its content.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

props.name: children
props.doc: To display additional related content, like useful links etc.
